Chapter.Title: Chapter 2-Urban Myth-‘They do not have the time to think about the terror at the end of the song, before the setting of the sun.’

Place.PlaceName: Location: Zwei Association - Southern Branch, Section 6

Dialog.Content: Any more reports on the Distortion from the Hana Association or Zwei Section 1?
None, sir. They’re all observing the situation for now.
They did nominate a number of likely suspects, however.
So far, we have two Urban Plagues, ‘Laundry of Dreams’ and ‘Yesterday’s Promise’; and one Urban Legend, ‘The Church of Gears’.
The investigation hasn’t been going too well, is it?
Oh, and ‘The Library’, a recently appointed Urban Myth, is also on the list of possible sources.
Hah, so even the higher ups are clueless, aren’t they? Seeing as they’re throwing out random guesses now.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m starting to get used to sorting out books now.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Tell me, why are you helping me so submissively?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What? Remember when you said you’ll kill me if I don’t cooperate? Because I sure do.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And I can’t leave here by myself, either.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Though, you don’t appear to be motivated by fear?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ve seen quite a lot of people crawl along the floor, stricken with fear and terror.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Judging from my past observations, I doubt you’re helping me simply because you’re afraid of dying.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What the hell were you doing in the past…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: To be honest, I have a few things I wanna know about this place, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Such as?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You said you want to get the one perfect book as you gather books about the City, right?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I figured I could run into some fun experiences if I joined you on that journey.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t have a whole lot to do out there, anyway. I’d go back to being a washed up Fixer, scraping at the bottom of the barrel again.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …And there is one thing I’ve been meaning to figure out more than anything else.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m hoping I could maybe find an answer here one day if I stick around and help you out.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: We have a coincidence of interests, I see.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sure, as much as I exploit you, you’re free to make use of me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Try to be careful about it, though. A careless attempt could seriously get you killed.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sheesh, you’re being way too vicious with words.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Just what made you so sharp?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …You’d better not pry into my past any further. I already feel like slowly melting your limbs this time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Fine, geez…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Uhm, I have a question, ma’am. Do you take questions, ma’am?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What is it now? Make sure it’s an appropriate question. I did warn you already.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What’s up with the librarians here? They don’t really “feel” like real humans…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But they don’t seem to be machines or artificial creatures, either.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Entities called Abnormalities and employees, both of which were thoroughly exploited by the facility that once stood upon where we are…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They’re just like me in that sense.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Originated from humans, taken advantage of, and abandoned once grown out of use.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I dunno, what you’re doing with them now still looks like exploitation…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They were broken. They couldn’t even sustain a stable form, and their existence was so fragile they could fade away at any moment. They’re barely kept together as I’ve bound them to a physical body and a book.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: All I can do for them now is to find the one book that will free me and the librarians.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re going to release the librarians?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s the only way for any of us to leave, you know?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I used the same kind of power to reconstruct your body.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hunh…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Just remember this.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: As we collect numerous books from our guests, we will eventually reach the one absolute book that contains everything.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Nope, not this, that won’t do either… I can’t seem to find the one that strikes me with inspiration!

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: Hey there, Pierre~ Brought you some fresh ones this time.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: They got bruised a bit too hard, but they’re still breathing.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: What, busy developing a new dish?

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Welcome, Jack~!

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Dishes are one thing, but we’re running way too short on ingredients these days.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Luckily I have my reliable friend Jack here, so I won’t have to worry about that for a while.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: What happened?

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: ‘The Musicians of Bremen’ say they’re no longer selling ingredients to us.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: Those freaks were always unpredictable.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: What about ‘Little Piggy's’, then?

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Same deal, stopped trading with us…

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: We’ll have to do this the old way. You and I, together.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: I’d love to, but we can’t go to our usual spot anymore.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: The, uhh… ‘Zwei Association’ is safeguarding that area now.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Then we should pioneer new supply chains!

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: While we’re at it, I want to be more experimental with new ingredients. I’ve been using only young ones for far too long.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: Aw, that’s unfortunate… I’ll miss the pasty hand pies that you make…

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: You’ll have to deal with it, unfortunate as it is. Since we’ve lost several vendors that used to provide quality meat for us, sticking to conventional dishes won’t cut it. Gourmets will surely notice the drop in the quality of our ingredients.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: You were aiming to become one of ‘The Eight Chefs’, right, Pierre?

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: That’s right! The Eight Chefs are the brightest of the Stars of the City that shine over us.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: They never fail to present us with stunning and sensational flavors.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: What kind of new ingredients are you looking for?

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: Aged ones should be easier to get, though their meat tends to be squishy. It’s not everyone’s favorite, but some like it.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: I’m not looking for a compromise. I want a taste that differentiates us from other restaurants.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Ever heard of the Library? I heard monsters live there.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: It may still be an Urban Myth, but monster meat is usually hard to get unless we travel all the way to the Outskirts.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: Oho… Now that’s promising…

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Isn’t it? I got an invitation from that library some time ago, see?

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: I’ll surprise the gourmets with a dish that’s so stimulating and novel, it could even rival the Eight Chefs themselves.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: So, Jack, you can just count on me and follow my lead, understand?

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: What are we gonna do with the ingredients I brought today then?

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Ah, let’s turn them into jam.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: We’re bottling them alive, so put ‘em on drips of anesthetics and repressors and store ‘em in the kneader.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: Meat jam’s nice…

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: I knew you’d love it!

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Oh, and as I said before, you have to put ‘em legs first, not headfirst. We gotta keep them alive as long as possible, you know.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: It’s not as flavorful if they die too quickly.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Cannibalism is a thing in the Backstreets it seems?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There are quite a few perverted maniacs who are into that, yeah.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But it’s kind of a taboo even in the Backstreets. You certainly can’t go around saying how tasty human meat is.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s actually the wealthy folk who consume human meat the most.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: However… The Backstreets of District 23 are an exception.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: People there only care about pursuing the ultimate flavor, and will do anything for it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Each part of the Backstreets seems to have its own set of characteristics.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It mostly depends on the policies set by the Nest and the Wing.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Though most of the Backstreets are being neglected anyway.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Is human meat particularly delicious or anything?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heck if I know. Never tried, never wanna.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Those guys are kidnapping ordinary people and cooking them right after.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Gourmets seem to think that such cruelty only adds to the flavor…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Even worse, they believe cooking people alive and making them suffer as much as possible is key to perfecting taste.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Humans eating humans. What a sight to behold.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Mmm~ This is a brand new smell.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: I don’t think I like this scent.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Now, Jack, it’s unfamiliarity like this that brings forth new ideas, you see?

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: If you say so.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Woooooow~ What a wonderful-looking ingredient, with such a glossy appearance…

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: She certainly looks like a fresh, top-grade ingredient on the outside, but… Pierre?

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Yeah, I know. She’s unfortunately not a human.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: But! That’s why I’m even more excited. How do you taste?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m afraid you cannot do any harm to me.

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: We never know until we try.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Stay calm, Jack. We should keep our manners. She’s the wonderful individual who’s invited us here, you see?

Dialog.Title: Pierre’s Sous-chef
Dialog.Content: Oh, yeah… I apologize for my rudeness, ma’am.

Dialog.Title: Chef de Cuisine
Dialog.Content: Now then, Miss Angela? May we enter now?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ugh, what a bunch of nutcases. It’s best not to interact with the likes of them.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: At least they were more well-mannered than you.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well here’s a word of wisdom for our still naive Miss Librarian!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: If you meet a polite and well-mannered person in the Backstreets, run for your life.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Not all lunatics are polite, but polite people tend to be lunatics.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m not sure if that has anything to do with politeness.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And here’s another word of wisdom!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Lunatics always exist in any given group of people, so there’s no point in using any criteria to divide people into groups to see which is more insane.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What a load of bull.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Ahh~ Why is our Office so unpopular with clients.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Our Office is officially designated by the Zwei Association as an affiliate, too.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: And the crime rate of territories secured by the Streetlight Office remains at a remarkable 0% as long as the contract is in effect!!!

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: We only cover two blocks of space at most, though.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: And we’ll eventually get work if we wait.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah, sure, you can keep waiting for the rest of your life. I’m seriously considering moving to another Office.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Never thought you’d have what it takes to work for a bigger Office.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Unlike you, I have several business connections I made from experience, do you understand?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Your mother must be too busy being a legendary Fixer or whatever, while I have friends who can help me right away.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah, some great Fixer you are~

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah yeah. Why thanks, I know I’m great~

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hey!!! You ate the cake in the fridge, didn’t you!!!!!

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Guys, I have work for you.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: …Fighting again, are you…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: This S.O.B ate the cake without even asking me!!

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: The expiration date was yesterday, so I took care of it, that’s all.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Auuuuuuuuugh!!!!! It’s MY cake, and even if it’s expired, I’ll take care of it on MY own!!!

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Anyway, boss, how about that work?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Don’t change the topic!!!

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I’ll get you another cake, so calm down for a moment, alright?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: But… That was a limited edition cake…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I’m still rather skeptical about it, but I got this one from a friend of mine at the Association.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: You mean that Associate Fixer working directly under the Zwei?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Yes, it’s her. The Hana Association has yet to consider this request as a subject that needs to be addressed officially.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Have you heard of ‘The Library’?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Some stories of it. We overheard Rats talking about it.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Said the books in that place have tremendous value or whatever.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I see. I retrieved an invitation to that library from my friend I just mentioned.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: But we might not get much payment from this request if it’s off the record.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: And it won’t count towards our official career, either.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Such as it is… The Association is trying to remain cautious about it.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Are we really going to walk right into a place we know nothing about?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: She did promise to see to it that we’re rewarded with pay comparable to an Urban Legend-class request if everything goes down well…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Surely it was a bad idea after all, don’t you think…?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Let’s do this!

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Guess we have no choice. It’s still too uncertain, but we need that money. We haven’t been too busy lately.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Thanks, everyone! We’ll get through like we always have.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Zwei? Hana?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re talking about associations of Fixers. It takes more than just setting up an Office to jump into the Fixer business.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There are a total of twelve Fixer Associations across the City, each in charge of different types of work.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Cases and requests are all sorted according to the type and sent to one of these associations.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Associations manage Offices and delegate work to them, I see.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s right. Sometimes, the Association might send documents to multiple Offices at once, or directly have Associate Fixers take care of the work.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And among them, the Hana Association is in overall control of all Fixers. They grade Fixers and authorize Offices and stuff.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Do Offices have grades as well?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Essentially. The requests sent out by the Associations are graded, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They really love to grade things, don’t they.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s easier to know that way.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Know what?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: How valuable I am as a person…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Think about it, who in the City could claim “This is my worth!” with confidence?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Everyone’s busy minding their own business, no one is going to lounge around having deep conversations about each other’s value.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Knowing each other’s grades and affiliations, on the other hand, can save a ton of words. You can tell if you’re above or below the person you’re talking to right away.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sounds like people stopped trying to learn or think about it at some point.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Bet you won’t say the same once you experience the city life for a bit.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You have to interact with so many people out there, whether you want to or not.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: People have been looking for ways to adapt to the City, and this is just one of them.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Guess we really are desperate. To think that we’d take on a job like this…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Stop complaining, we should be glad to have work at all.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: I know! Do you really have to point out the obvious?!

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Now now, cool it down, guys.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Can’t tell if you’re best friends or worst enemies.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Excuse me! Please don’t associate me with this goof!

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: I certainly don’t want that, either.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Alright, alright. Let’s have a feast at Juli’s restaurant once this is over. The tab’s on me.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests. You seem to be well acquainted with each other.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Who are you?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Prepare yourselves.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There is no need to be so wary. Your ordeal has not started yet.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Nice to meet you. I’m San from the Streetlight Office.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: We were brought here by the invitation. There’s something I’d like to ask about it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What is it?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I actually retrieved this invitation from another person, not directly from you. Are we still eligible?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yes, indeed. The invitation eventually reached you, dear guest, and you signed your name with your own will. Everything has worked as intended.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I see.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Huh, she was a nicer person than I thought.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Did that look like a human to you?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: I mean, she did have the shape of a person, but something about her didn’t feel right…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Though I can’t exactly put it to words…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: She… probably is a machine.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Didn’t expect to see a machine that’s so similar to a human being…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Let’s focus on our work.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Once again, you must back off as soon as you feel that you’re in danger.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re still rookies.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s not a good idea for Fixers to form such tight bonds with each other.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, I guess this’ll be a lesson for them.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You talk as if you’re used to all this.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, I’ve already grown past that phase, and some more too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Forming bonds aren’t bad per se, but there’s just too much risk associated with it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The real deal Fixers know when to cut things off.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You mean to keep enough distance from people, so that you won’t feel hurt from their losses?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep. It’s just ironic that people who aren’t even mentally prepared to face death are applying for a job that involves killing in the first place.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: …I’m terribly sorry. It’s all my fault that the job went wrong.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: We are taking our hands off of the Library from now on.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: This was out of our scope to begin with. I already sent a report to the Zwei.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: What? What about Mars? Was his death pointless then?!

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I really am sorry… You can blame me all you want.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: I misjudged. Our profession is peacekeeping, not exploration or combat.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: There’s a cake in the fridge… Was that you, boss?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Operator
Dialog.Content: Cake? No, I didn’t buy any cake yet…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: …I’ll go outside for a bit.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Wahhhhhhhh!!!!! You stupid idiot…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s not like you at all to buy cakes for others…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: You said your mother’s an amazing Fixer…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: You loved to show off your stupidly huge sword, saying it’s a gift from her…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: You bragged so much that you’d be just like your mother someday…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Mars’ book… That’s what happens to the people who die in there…?

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: I won’t let them toy with him… I’ll never let them…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: San’ll totally try to stop me if I bring this up…

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’ll go there on my own. I’ve got friends to help me, too…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Boy, this is frankly heartbreaking. Shouldn’t have seen that.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s funny, coming from the one who gave a speech on how Fixers shouldn’t cling to bonds.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s that, and this is this.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Still, reacting to every bit of loss is a waste of energy. Everybody lives with burdens to bear.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I have my share of unfortunate events, and so do others.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And it’s rude to expose that without the listener’s agreement. They’ll be bothered to learn something they didn’t really have to know.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re already carrying a hefty load of emotional baggage, and telling them your sob story will feel like you’re showing off how heavy your own baggage is. They might feel a bit of sympathy, but they’ll also be displeased.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Don’t overexpress your feelings whether you’re happy or sad, and say goodbye to each other with the appropriate words. It’s all for the sake of each other.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That sounds even more tiring to me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And I shouldn’t let my feelings distract me from my librarian work, most of all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I gotta stay level-headed and help you collect books about the City.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re right. As soon as you become useless to me, I’ll dispose of you.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Then I’ll go back to my duties of being a useful servant for the sake of my survival, ma’am.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetin—

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: Shut up. I don’t need a greeting from a despicable piece of junk.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’m here for Mars’ book. I’ll get his book, kill all the monsters here, and blow your head clean off.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m afraid your third statement is going to be difficult for you to fulfill, dear guest.

Dialog.Title: Streetlight Fixer
Dialog.Content: I said shut up.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh… May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are you feeling guilt or any strong emotions?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’d be lying if I said I feel nothing, but…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ve already seen plenty of these cheap tragedies. Been the victim myself a whole lot of times, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You sound like a seasoned veteran for someone who introduced himself as a “washed-up Fixer”.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I have my reasons. What, are you curious?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You said it’s a rude thing to do, didn’t you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Besides, I could simply turn you into a book and read your story if I really wanted to know.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whoa now, let’s not go there yet…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, how about you? I’m curious to know what our head librarian thinks.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Me? Indifferent. I’ve also seen relationships and scripted deaths too many times, in repeat.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So I’ve been trying to run a system where people are free to choose their own destiny this time around, free from any coercion.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I mean, sure, they all read the warnings on the invitations and agree to those terms by signing their names, but…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s still a bit dirty, y’know. You’re unkillable, and I can revive whenever I die.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Again with that. I thought you said my method is fair?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah, yeah. You aren’t wrong. Much more polite and fair than most things in the City.
